intro: Dicerandra linearifolia var. robustior, commonly known as the robust dicerandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its linear, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. The plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
